meanings.definition: A substance or medium that does not conduct electricity.
meanings.sent1: The dielectric prevented the flow of electricity through the circuit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the dielectric properties of various materials.
meanings.sent3: The dielectric material decided it was tired of being shocked all the time.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as a dielectric shield against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The thick dielectric layer acted as a barrier, blocking the electrical current.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or exhibiting the properties of a dielectric material.
meanings.sent1: The dielectric properties of the material made it ideal for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The dielectric coating protected the electronic device from interference.
meanings.sent3: The dielectric paint gave the room a futuristic look.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a dielectric wall, impervious to outside influences.
meanings.sent5: The dielectric nature of the fabric kept the wearer safe from electric shocks.

meanings.sent1: He needed to dielectrically isolate the wires to prevent a short circuit.
meanings.sent2: The electrician dielectrically shielded the exposed cables.
meanings.sent3: She tried to dielectrically distance herself from the drama.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range dielectrically divided the two regions.
meanings.sent5: The thick walls dielectrically protected the inhabitants from lightning strikes.
